column4: I'd love it if someone could give me some advice/insight on a problem I'm having. I'm currently running Ubuntu 8.10 in VMware, where the base is Windows XP x64.   Well, when I attempt to download anything, including updates, the download starts strong, at about 500 KB/s. After a few seconds, it drops down to about 5-200 B/s.  I've tried it on several similar base machines, and made several VMs of different Ubuntu releases, and I have the same problem. I ru
Does anyone have any insight to the issue I seem to be running into, or no? I'd appreciate any thoughts on the matter.
if you're download drops in the VM is it still high on Windows ?
Yes, I am. None of the other VMs (or the base machine) I've tried have had the problem. And I've run it from a Live CD, and haven't had the problem.
I keep my download speed at around 500 KB/s in everything BUT the Ubuntu VM. The base machine. XP VM, Vista VM, and my Fedora VM.
try to start a download in Windows when the rate drops in the VM. If it's still low on Windows it might not come from the VM or Ubuntu
I've tried that, and it's high on the Windows side of things, but the Ubuntu side stays low.
it could either come from the VM configuration, or the Ubuntu configuration
I would try to play around with the VM options, because Ubuntu in a vm is usually pretty standard.
maybe try to change the way you are sharing your network interface
these are just ideas.. It's hard to tell what your problem could be

I had assumed that I had most likely mis-configured something, though I've no what it is. I've tried adjusting both VM settings and Ubuntu settings, especially the ones concerning connectivity to a network, and it doesn't seem to change anything.
I appreciate the help you've given, so thanks. I simply got so frustrated with it that I had to ask someone for help. It took over 2 hours to download a few small updates the other day.
are you using NAT or Bridged to share the network interface ? or have you tried both ?
